description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to strengthen the management of public finances and to establish a more efficient, effective and transparent public procurement system through: (i) upgrading the public financial management system; (ii) upgrading the e-procurement platform; (iii) enhancing the internal control systems over personnel expenditures; and (iv) building capacity of the Central Administration.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Compliance audit for results indicators. | Description :Not later than 6 months after each year of Projectimplementation (starting in 2012), the Recipient shall cause the auditors to carry out annual operational audits (Section V.A,Schedule 2) | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Financial Audit Company has been hired. | Description :The Recipient shall, not later than 3 months after theEffective Date, hire independent auditors, for purposes of carrying out the annual audits of the Financial Statements: (Section B.4Schedule 2) | Due Date :15-May-2012

Finance Agreement :Memorandum (MoU) on Inter-institutional Arrangements for project implementation | Description :The Recipient,through SEFIN, shall enter into a memorandum of understanding (MOU) with Secretaria de Presidencia, under terms and conditionsacceptable to the Association. (Section I.4, Schedule 2) | Due Date :01-Feb-2012

Finance Agreement :Operational Auditors have been hired. | Description :The Recipient shall not later than 3 months after theEffective Date hire independent auditors (Section V.A, Schedule 2). | Due Date :15-May-2012

Finance Agreement :Project Coordination Unit | Description :The recipient, through SEFIN shall operate and maintain a projectcoordination unit (UAP), with functions, staffing, and responsibilities satisfactory to the Association (Section I.A.2, Schedule2). | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Publication of the Procurement Plan in SEPA | Description :Supply SEPA with the information contained in theinitial Procurement Plan within thirty (30) days after the Project has been approved by the Association. (Section III. A.4.k,Schedule 2). | Due Date :09-Jan-2012

title.narrative: Number of framework agreements implemented for common use goods
Improved professionalization of public service in selected institutions

baseline.value: Appointments to professional positions in key institutions are highly politicized following clientelism rather than technicalcompetence.DEI has completed a revision of career and pay structures

target.value: Activities supporting professionalization in one more institution is completed

actual.value: SEFIN has completed the implementation of the payroll audits on 5 key entities (Education, Health, Infrastructure and SecuritySecretariats, as well as the Tax Administration Agency-DEI), and an Institutional Functional Review study is underway on all fourmentioned secretariats plus SEFIN and the Civil Service Directorate. The resulting report contains an action plan for thestrengthening of human resource management in Honduran public sector. However, due to time limitations it will not be possible tobe implemented by the end of December 2015. Note that the action plan envisions a series of actions and steps for 2016 and 2017.

title.narrative: PI-4: Stock and monitoring of expenditure payment arrears

actual.value: The PEFA rating will not be updated before the project closing date. So far, SIAFI II and SIAFI GES have a 100% coverage at thecentral level and 70% on decentralized institutions. Also, since the implementation of SIREP, all payments due to personnel aremade exclusively through SIAFI. Currently, UDEM is currently working on the development of interfaces between the two systems whilethe core financial functionalities of SIAFI GES are developed.

title.narrative: Publication of bidding opportunities (including documents) and contract award information

baseline.value: Less than 10% of bidding opportunities are published

target.value: 80% publication of bidding opportunities (including documents) and contract award information

actual.value: According to preliminary results from an analysis of the coverage of HonduCompras, approximately only 30% of the bidding processesare were registered in both the official Gaceta and HonduCompras as mandated by the norm. The current HonduCompras platform doesnotcontain updated information regarding contract award and contract modifications, as only the publication of the initial biddingdocuments is registered.

baseline.value: Limited institutional capacity of ONCAE to fulfill mandate

target.value: Procurement units in all central government institutions have received training in operation of new e-platform

actual.value: The new HonduCompras Platform has not been acquired and while bidding documents and terms of reference for an off-the-shelf systemhave been completed, ONCAE does not have enough personnel to run the system. On this regard, permanent staff positions are expectedto be filled by February 2016. The staffing of ONCAE will also allow the creation of a Procurement Intelligence Unit based on thestatistical analytical work performed by ONCAE´s procurement analysts funded by the IPSP project. However, these actions will takeafter Project closure. Simultaneously, a Communications Strategy for both the PDTSM and ONCAE has been prepared and the standardbiding documents have been updated with Bank support. Its implementation however is scheduled to begin next fiscal year.

title.narrative: Number of sector cabinets using the indicators and goals established in the M&E system and basing their decisions based on the information provided by the system

target.value: 6 sector cabinets using the indicators and goals established in the M&E system. An increase in user satisfaction.

actual.value: Implementation of the developed sectorial strategies and indicators was completed in 4 out of 7 sector cabinets. The indicators andtools developed were also successfully integrated with the new budgeting module of SIAFI GES and used for during the 2016 budgetformulation. Currently the Presidential Directorate of Strategic Planning, Budgeting and Public Investment is about to undergo acomprehensive review of the quality of the information uploaded in to the system as part of the budget adjustment processes.

title.narrative: Accreditation of SIAFI users in central government institutions

target.value: All SIAFI users in financial management units of central government institutions are accredited.

actual.value: Not achieved. So far, only the budgeting formulation module of SIAFI GES has been developed. As a result, UDEM has focused thetraining activities on this module at a conceptual level. The training covered over 1000 employees from all 88 central governmentinstitutions and from 70% of decentralized agencies.

title.narrative: New e-procurement platform implemented and at least 25% of procurement transactions carried out online

baseline.value: No transactional e-procurement platform in place

target.value: At least 25% of procurement transactions carried out online

actual.value: Not achieved. While the bidding documents for the new platform have been completed, ONCAE has no institutional capacity in place tooperate the new platform. Staff positions for ONCAE have been opened and the personnel is expected to start on February 2016.Currently, the Presidential Directorate for Transparency and State Modernization is exploring potential funding alternatives todevelop the system based on the functional and conceptual design developed under the Project.

baseline.value: Score of 11 out of 100 in OBI 2010

target.value: Improvement on OBI index (at least 50 out of 100).

actual.value: While according to the Transparency International OBI the Country made significant improvements that allowed it to achieve a scoreof 53 out of 100 between 2013 and 2014, the latest 2015 report implied a significant drop, placing the score at 42 out of 100. Thedrop was explained by the lack of comprehensive budget information made available to the public during the formulation process. Onthis regard, UDEM has implemented a Business Intelligence tool to perform queries on SIAFI through SEFIN´s webpage, and is planningto enable a consultation modus with pre-established reports that will be made public on SIAFI GES web page.

title.narrative: Additional functionalities of SIAFI system implemented

baseline.value: Some functionalities have not been implemented and others have been implemented partially (travel, HR, administration of goods,etc.)

target.value: All additional functionalities are in place and operating

actual.value: Currently, only the budget formulation module was completed and the Ministry of Finance Modernization Unit (UDEM by its Spanishacronym) is in the processes of preparing the budget modification module. The remaining core financial functionalities (treasuryand accounting) have not been yet completely documented and developed. According to UDEMs latest implementation schedule,documentation will be completed by June 2016 and software development will begin in July. The complete set of plannedfunctionalities is expected to begin production on January 2017.

title.narrative: Institutional coverage of the updated SIAFI

baseline.value: The current framework (used by 100% of Central Government and 3 decentralized institutions) complies with internationalbest-practice but needs to be updated

target.value: 100% of Central Government and 80% of decentralized institutions operate with the updated SIAFI

actual.value: As of the mission date only the budgeting formulation module has been completed and implemented on all central government and 70 %of the decentralized institutions. Nevertheless, SIAFI GES has not yet been fully completed and the Ministry of Finance willcontinue the development of the core financial modules throughout 2016.

title.narrative: Enhanced control over personnel expenditure in identified high risk areas

baseline.value: Weak control over personnel expenditure in high risk areas

target.value: Implementation of corrective measures following findings of transactions-based payroll audit for contracted personnel in the HealthMinistry and in the Public Works Ministry are completed, leading to at least 3 percent savings in contracted personnel expendituresin both institutions on an annual basis

actual.value: Five payroll audits have been completed. However, implementation of the corrective actions recommended is still pending and havebeen linked to the broad Action Plan prepared under the Institutional Functional Review study. The timeframe for the implantationof the plan however extends beyond the Project closing date.

title.narrative: Improved control over payroll management in all central government institutions

baseline.value: Weak controls over payroll processing in central administration institutions

target.value: Payroll management audits# action plans are fully implemented in all central government institutions.

actual.value: SEFIN has completed the implementation of the payroll audits on 5 key entities (Education, Health, Infrastructure and SecuritySecretariats, as well as the Tax Administration Agency-DEI), and an Institutional Functional Review study is underway on all fourmentioned secretariats plus SEFIN and the Civil Service Directorate. The resulting report contains an action plan for thestrengthening of human resource management in Honduran public sector. However, due to time limitations it will not be possible tobe implemented by the end of December 2015. Note that the action plan envisions a series of actions and steps for 2016 and 2017.
